intro: Kickxia incana, commonly known as the hairy rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves. It produces yellow flowers in early spring, followed by small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
